definition.name: NXapm_paraprobe_config_tessellator

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

definition.doc: Configuration of a paraprobe-tessellator tool run in atom probe microscopy.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version specifier of this application definition.

field.name: definition
field.doc: Official NeXus NXDL schema with which this file was written.

field.name: program
field.doc: Given name of the program/software/tool with which this NeXus (configuration) file was generated.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Ideally program version plus build number, or commit hash or description of ever persistent resources where the source code of the program and build instructions can be found so that the program can be configured ideally in such a manner that the result of this computational process is recreatable in the same deterministic manner.

field.name: analysis_identifier
field.doc: Ideally, a (globally persistent) unique identifier for referring to this analysis.

field.name: analysis_description
field.doc: Possibility for leaving a free-text description about this analysis.

field.name: time_stamp
field.doc: ISO 8601 formatted time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when this configuration file was created.

field.name: number_of_processes
field.doc: How many individual analyses should the tool execute.

group.name: ion_to_edge_distances
group.doc: The tool enables to inject precomputed distance information for each point which can be used for further post-processing and analysis.

field.name: filename
field.doc: Name of an HDF5 file which contains the ion distances. Users are responsible this file and referred to dataset under dataset_name have an ion_distance value for each ion.

attribute.name: version
attribute.doc: Version identifier of the file such as a secure hash which documents the binary state of the file to add an additional layer of reproducibility.

field.name: dataset_name
field.doc: Absolute HDF5 path to the dataset with distance values for each ion.

field.name: method
field.doc: Specifies for which points the tool will compute the tessellation. By default, a Voronoi tessellation is computed for all ions in the filtered point cloud.

field.name: has_cell_volume
field.doc: Specifies if the tool should report the volume of each cell.

field.name: has_cell_neighbors
field.doc: Specifies if the tool should report the first-order neighbors of each cell.

field.name: has_cell_geometry
field.doc: Specifies if the tool should report the facets and vertices of each cell.

field.name: has_cell_edge_detection
field.doc: Specifies if the tool should report if the cell makes contact with the tight axis-aligned bounding box about the point cloud. This can be used to identify if the shape of the cell is affected by the edge of the dataset or if cells are deeply enough embedded into the point cloud so that the shape of their cells are not affected by the presence of the boundary.

field.name: erosion_distance
field.doc: Maximum distance for which cells are eroded.
